content: Hey @nikomatsakis I believe on https://github.com/rust-lang/lang-team/issues/79 you were going to sync with Florian to get a more detailed agenda - I just wanted to put a reminder here and also am going to make a note in the action items doc
Yes, I talked to Florian some today
@nikomatsakis hey, wanted to check in on this - mostly wondering if there's reading material or otherwise to prepare for the meeting on Wednesday. Thanks!

OK, so this is the preliminary agenda. I would call this an 'exploratory meeting', with the goal of thinking over what a spec effort might look like. I enumerated some questions we might talk over but I think the plan is fairly open. It's a bit late notice but I think it's ok.

cc @Florian Gilcher, @T-lang

Will the meeting be recorded and uploaded to YouTube?
I'd really like to watch it afterwards :)
@Julian-Wollersberger In general, we do record and upload most meetings.
I'd expect this one to be.

Thanks!
I was asking because this is an especially interesting topic, and wanted to make sure it will be recorded.
Could you share some of the specifics you're interested in about this topic?
Might help inform some of the discussion.

It's mostly that I'm hyped about the possibilities of Rust being adopted in safety-critical system, or other areas where correctness is really important.
I don't have much to say myself, that's why I want to just watch it.
Maybe one thing: Formal verification tools would benefit from hooking into the compiler. So making rustc modular enough to make that possible. That would also make rustc easier to understand overall.

Formal tools would benefit from hooking into the compiler

http://smallcultfollowing.com/babysteps/blog/2020/04/09/libraryification/
Would help with https://rust-lang.zulipchat.com/#narrow/stream/266220-rustdoc/topic/cargo-callgraph as well
I do plan to record
is agenda reachable from Lang Team workspace in HackMD? (I’m using HackMd atop Flotato and its not trivial for me to go to a URL there.)
@nikomatsakis ^

pnkfelix said:

is agenda reachable from Lang Team workspace in HackMD?

(to be clear, it does not appear to be listed in that workspace that I see.)

pnkfelix said:

(I’m using HackMd atop Flotato and its not trivial for me to go to a URL there.)

((found workaround: Made scratch note for self, pasted url there, and followed it.))
@pnkfelix I will make it available:)
I don't have a join link, can someone post it?
or did I get the time wrong and it's happening some time else?
It happened about three hours ago, sorry. :(
ah lol ok
not sure what I put into my calendar
I probably had fun with timezones
I'll read the hackmd then, thanks
The lang design meeting is 2021-02-17T10:00:00-08:00 to 2021-02-17T11:00:00-08:00 every week.
Does that help?
jup!
Will it be uploaded in youtube by the way?
Should be.
